name: Melia Cayo Santa Maria

reviews.text: We Stayed at the Melia, the week of Sept 8th, and we had a great time. The Vacation starts off great, when you fly with West Jet, they always make the flight so enjoyable.
reviews.title: Beautiful Room

likes.disliked: — Being so far from the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was one of the nicest, rooms we've stayed in. The housekeepers always had it looking nice with the diffent towel creations, and did different things with the canopy, and always made the room so warm looking to come back to.
reviews.title: Dream Come True

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No problem with the air conditioning there, as it got quite cold in the night, we always had a blanket on the bed. A few nights we had to turn the power off, just to warm up again. Our room over looked the pool area, (if we would have been on the second floor we would have seen it )...but being on the first floor, we just looked out to bushes, but it was handy to be so close to the pool. The pool was great! All laid out in different colours, of blue, letting you know the three levels of depth.
reviews.title: Great trip!!!! Loved everything about it!
you get what you pay for
reviews.text: Being the third time to Cuba, we know the food isn't the greatest thing, but always something for everyone there, and the ala cart resturant, had the best filet mignon, I"ve ever tasted in the Carrabean, it was so tender, and topped off with the flaming crepe deserts made right at your table.

reviews.title: Above average
reviews.text: We go mainly for the beach.. and spend most of our day there, as others have said it is gorgeous, you can walk for miles......but the only draw back was the hill you had to climb down to get to the water, and then climb back up to get back to your chair..... As one guest said, "You have to be a mountain goat to get up the hill" The first few days there were a lot of jelly fish in the water, so it wasn't that comfortable being out there looking all the time... Just when I thought it was pretty safe, I got stung..
We have just returned from a week at the Melia Cayo Santa Maria. The hotel is excellent with an incredible all inclusive service.
reviews.title: Excellent, great management, great people, great resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 1025,( building # 10, second floor), junior suite, king bed, fridge with light drinks,(room service is coming every day around 6:00pm), umbrellas in each room
reviews.title: It was sooo good we came back seven times

likes.liked: — Resort was nice size and easy to get about and to get to know other guests
likes.disliked: — changing piano entertainment to lobby bar from piano bar location, more intimate and airconditioned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants are great: the best of Italian, Mediterranean and Caribean cuisine, champagne and fine white, red, rose wines.
reviews.title: 2nd time around - great resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have buffet for Breakfast and diner and a la carte in 2 locations for lunch.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach: clean and with excellent "animation team" and service directly on the beach.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a week at Melia Cayo Santa Maria (nov 12-19). It was my first time in Cuba, and overall it was a decent experience. The room was clean and the staff were helpful and spoke both english and french. The food was below average but I didn't have high expectations for the food.
reviews.title: Average
As a travel agent, I was disappointed!!!
reviews.text: Yes, there are stray cats, but they don't bother you (I'd rather see stray cats than mice)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were minor things that made the trip just average (food was blah, pool was cold, etc).
reviews.title: Melia Cayo? or Fawlty Towers?

likes.disliked: — If you are allergic to cats - there are 100s of them all over the resort

reviews.title: Wionderful Wedding & Honeymoon!
reviews.text: I would not recommend this resort to younger people looking to 'party'. It's a quiet resort (adults only) and when I went the average age was 35+. Plus the nearest town is far away, so you could get bored if you like an action packed vacation.

I think some of the negative comments regarding this resort are a bit harsh. I think if you are looking for a 5 star vacation where you are waited on hand and foot, and everyone speaks English, well then you should book a 5 star vacation (probably in the US - where they can accommodate all your nit picky needs)
reviews.title: Nice hotel, amazing staff

reviews.text: My friends and I went to the Melia Cayo from Oct 20th -27th, we had a fabulous time. We met alot of great people and the weather was awesome!! We rented a car for 3 days and toured the countryside which is very, very beautiful. Some of the roads were hard to find. The hotel however lets you use a staff member for your guide as well as translation. I found this to be more cost effective as well as more interesting than what the tour operators offer.
reviews.title: Melia and it's people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The money exchange is a bit of a ripoff and if you use a Canadian credit card it's a service fee of 11%. No American credit cards of it's affiliated ones allowed..ie Amex, citibank, capital one etc. If anyone is going there, PLEASE take pencils, pens and any school items you can carry, they are in desperate need of them. Try ti find Frank the omlette cook or Dennis, Lazaro or Ernesto who belong to the activities group, they will make sure the kids get it. Tell them Brian sent you.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: Have fun when you go down, and remember that the food is not like ours, take alot of pepto and laxatives! Enjoy!!!
reviews.title: Exceptional staff, incredible beach, breathtaking pools, etc.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since I relied on this website for advice about the Melia Cayo Santa Maria, I felt it was only fair to add my comments. We travelled the 1st week of October. We got an amazing deal ($1640 Cdn, total for 2 people, with an oceanview room). We travelled Westjet from Toronto, which was awesome. Can't get better than that.
reviews.title: Nice Resort

likes.disliked: — The 1 1/2 hr drive from the airport, shower

reviews.title: Making Memories
reviews.text: We've been to many places (Jamaica, DR, Mexico) and only stay at 4+ or 5* resorts. We have never been to Cuba - and for the price we paid we weren't expecting much. This resort totally surprised us. We basically had no complaints; it was an amazing place.

aka: Melia Cayo Santa Maria Hotel Cayo Santa Maria
description: In an island paradise off the northern coast of Cuba stands the 5- star All-Inclusive Meliá Cayo Santa María hotel, especially designed for families, surrounded by beautiful beaches and lush tropical vegetation. This property (358 rooms) offers facilities for incentives groups and a special wedding and honeymoon program. A perfect complement for an unforgettable holiday.
